meanings.definition: Cause severe and extensive damage to.
meanings.sent1: The storm will ravage the town with its strong winds and heavy rain.
meanings.sent2: The wildfire continued to ravage the forest, leaving behind a path of destruction.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel managed to ravage the entire garden in search of nuts.
meanings.sent4: The invasive species began to ravage the delicate ecosystem, disrupting the natural balance.
meanings.sent5: The relentless waves of the ocean seemed to ravage the coastline, eroding it slowly over time.

meanings.definition: The action of causing severe and extensive damage to.
meanings.sent1: The aftermath of the hurricane's ravage was evident in the broken buildings and uprooted trees.
meanings.sent2: The ravage of war left scars on the landscape that would take years to heal.
meanings.sent3: The toddler's playtime turned into a playful ravage of the toy box, scattering toys everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The ravage of time could be seen in the worn-out pages of the ancient book.
meanings.sent5: The ravage of neglect was visible in the abandoned house, with overgrown weeds and peeling paint.
